snippet: Detroit, Michigan’s most populous city, is at risk of running out of money as early as next month.
abstract: Detroit Mayor Dave Bing uses his annual state of the city address to argue against the appointment of an outside emergency manager to take over the city's dire financial situation, contending that budget cuts alone will not be a sufficient remedy; calls on Michigan to provide financial help for the city's own plan toward financial solvency.
lead_paragraph: Detroit, Michigan’s most populous city, is at risk of running out of money as early as next month.

headline.seo: Mayor of Ailing Detroit Resists Outside Takeover
headline.main: Mayor of Ailing Detroit Resists Outside Takeover
headline.print_headline: Mayor of Ailing Detroit Resists Outside Takeover
